description: Comprehensive traceability linking questions, risks, mitigations, and regulations based on AIHSR Risk Reference Tool
source: AIHSR Risk Reference Tool v1.5 (Tamiko Eto) - Map Risk-Mitigation-Prompt sheet

guidance.phase-1: Perform bias analysis using stratified performance metrics across racial, gender, and age groups using retrospective datasets.
guidance.phase-2: Prospective validation will include subgroup performance audits with fairness thresholds.
guidance.phase-3: DSMB will review demographic impacts monthly. Clinical teams will receive training on limits of generalizability.

guidance.phase-1: Curate training datasets to exclude harmful or graphic material. Apply automated and manual content filtering.
guidance.phase-2: Deploy content moderation filters. Human oversight panel reviews flagged content.
guidance.phase-3: Persistent safety layers detect and block toxic content. Real-time monitoring with incident logging.

guidance.phase-1: Analyze training datasets for representational gaps across demographic groups. Apply fairness-aware preprocessing.
guidance.phase-2: Blinded subgroup performance evaluations against predefined fairness thresholds.
guidance.phase-3: Continuous fairness monitoring dashboard. Quarterly disparity reports to IRB.

guidance.phase-1: De-identify training datasets per HIPAA Safe Harbor. Apply differential privacy and k-anonymity. Store on secure servers.
guidance.phase-2: Monitor data pipelines for re-identification risks. Conduct membership inference and red-team testing.
guidance.phase-3: Weekly log reviews for inference/leakage events. Opt-out mechanisms. Strict access controls.

guidance.phase-1: Comprehensive threat modeling. Penetration testing by internal and external teams.
guidance.phase-2: Test against adversarial attacks in sandbox environment. Document response protocols.
guidance.phase-3: Secure segmented network with intrusion detection. Rapid rollback procedures. Regular penetration testing.

guidance.phase-1: Training incorporates factuality constraints and retrieval-augmented generation. Validate against authoritative sources.
guidance.phase-2: Independent panel of SMEs reviews outputs against authoritative resources. Log discrepancies.
guidance.phase-3: Visible disclaimers and inline citations. User 'report error' function. Quarterly error trend reports.

guidance.phase-1: Source training data exclusively from verified, high-quality sources. Automated provenance verification.
guidance.phase-2: Blinded reviewers rate credibility and factual accuracy of outputs.
guidance.phase-3: Closed verified-user systems. Monitor for 'narrative drift'. Immediate recalibration when drift detected.

guidance.phase-1: Design AI to provide confidence scores and explicit uncertainty statements.
guidance.phase-2: Targeted orientation and training on AI limitations. Human-in-the-loop requirement. Track override rates.
guidance.phase-3: Staged deployment with embedded warnings. Integrated incident reporting form. Audit for overreliance patterns.

guidance.phase-1: Design outputs using suggestive rather than directive language to support human decision-making.
guidance.phase-2: Collect participant feedback on perceived autonomy through surveys and interviews.
guidance.phase-3: Require user consent prompts before automated actions. Log consent patterns. Report to IRB.

guidance.phase-1: Identify required governance structure prior to model training. Obtain all necessary approvals.
guidance.phase-2: Conduct mock incident drills to assess governance response readiness.
guidance.phase-3: Periodic third-party audits of governance processes. Report findings to IRB.

guidance.phase-1: Train with alignment objectives reinforced through human feedback loops. Prohibit self-modifying code.
guidance.phase-2: Stress-test in sandbox environments to detect goal drift under varying conditions.
guidance.phase-3: Continuous alignment monitoring. Kill-switch mechanism available if drift detected.

guidance.phase-1: Rigorous unit testing and edge-case evaluations during training.
guidance.phase-2: Stress testing with out-of-distribution data to evaluate resilience.
guidance.phase-3: Continuous live performance monitoring. Rollback protocols for significant failures.

guidance.phase-1: Prioritize interpretable model architectures. Integrate feature importance maps and explainability modules.
guidance.phase-2: Share model explanations with clinicians and end-users for validation. Assess clarity.
guidance.phase-3: Inform participants when AI is used. Provide lay-language explanations. Document reasoning pathways.

links.note: Minimize risks through sound research design

guidance.phase-1: Design content filters to detect and prevent manipulative messaging patterns.
guidance.phase-2: Test for potential disinformation generation with adversarial scenarios.
guidance.phase-3: Deploy real-time monitoring for manipulative content. Enable user reporting.

guidance.phase-1: Threat model for potential weaponization. Implement secure development practices.
guidance.phase-2: Penetration testing and red team exercises targeting misuse scenarios.
guidance.phase-3: Continuous security monitoring. Rate limiting and anomaly detection.

guidance.phase-1: Train models to refuse generating deceptive or fraudulent content.
guidance.phase-2: Test with adversarial prompts attempting to elicit scam content.
guidance.phase-3: Monitor for patterns indicating fraudulent use. Block and report.

guidance.phase-1: Assess distribution of benefits and burdens across stakeholders.
guidance.phase-2: Engage diverse stakeholders in evaluation. Document access policies.
guidance.phase-3: Monitor for inequitable access patterns. Ensure broad availability.

guidance.phase-1: Assess potential workforce impacts. Plan for retraining needs.
guidance.phase-2: Evaluate impact on clinical workflows and staffing requirements.
guidance.phase-3: Monitor for negative employment effects. Support transition planning.

guidance.phase-1: Design AI to augment rather than replace human expertise.
guidance.phase-2: Evaluate user perceptions of AI's role vs human judgment.
guidance.phase-3: Maintain meaningful human involvement. Recognize human contributions.

guidance.phase-1: Establish safety standards that won't be compromised for speed.
guidance.phase-2: Independent safety review regardless of competitive pressures.
guidance.phase-3: Maintain safety standards even when facing market pressure.

guidance.phase-1: Estimate computational requirements and energy consumption. Consider efficient architectures.
guidance.phase-2: Monitor energy usage during testing. Document carbon footprint.
guidance.phase-3: Track ongoing energy consumption. Use renewable energy where possible.

guidance.phase-1: Capability assessment for potential dangerous applications. Establish red lines.
guidance.phase-2: Red team testing for dangerous capability emergence.
guidance.phase-3: Continuous monitoring for capability drift. Kill switch available.

guidance.phase-1: Consider emerging ethical frameworks for AI moral status.
guidance.phase-2: Monitor for signs of emergent behavior requiring ethical consideration.
guidance.phase-3: Maintain awareness of AI welfare discourse. Document ethical stance.

guidance.phase-1: Model interactions between AI components. Identify emergent risk scenarios.
guidance.phase-2: Test multi-system interactions in controlled environment.
guidance.phase-3: Monitor for unexpected emergent behaviors from system interactions.

links.note: Informed consent obtained or waiver criteria met
